message.content:
There are six basic verb tenses in English: present, past, and future simple; present, past, and future continuous; and present and past perfect. Each of these tenses has a specific function and is used to express different types of actions or events.

1. Present Simple: This tense is used to describe an action that happens now, or that usually happens at the same time every day. For example: "I eat breakfast every morning."
2. Past Simple: This tense is used to describe a completed action in the past. For example: "I went to the store yesterday."
3. Present Continuous: This tense is used to describe an action that starts now and continues into the future. For example: "I have been studying for two hours."
4. Past Continuous: This tense is used to describe an action that started in the past and continued until a specific time in the past. For example: "She was working on her project when she received the call."
5. Future Simple: This tense is used to describe an action that will happen at a specific time in the future. For example: "I will go to the movies tomorrow night."
6. Future Continuous: This tense is used to describe an action that will start and continue until a specific time in the future. For example: "We are going to be on vacation for two weeks next month."
7. Present Perfect: This tense is used to describe an action that started in the past and completed at an unspecified time before now. For example: "I have finished my homework."
8. Past Perfect: This tense is used to describe an action that happened before another action in the past. For example: "She had eaten breakfast before she went to work."
9. Future Perfect: This tense is used to describe an action that will be completed at a specific time in the future. For example: "I will have finished my project by next week."
10. Future Perfect Continuous: This tense is used to describe an action that will start and continue until a specific time in the future, and will be completed before another action in the future. For example: "They are going to be on vacation for two weeks next month, and they will have finished their project by then."

It's important to note that not all verb tenses are used in every sentence or context, and some verb tenses can be combined with each other to create more complex sentences.
